p: The criminal or administrative response to drug use offences is the responsibility of the EU Member States, not of the EU. According to Article 168 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the EU, “The Union shall complement the Member States’ action in reducing drugs-related health damage, including information and prevention” [ 53]. There are some EU laws affecting cannabis trafficking offences. The Council Resolution on cannabis of July 2004 [ 54] encouraged the EU Member States to take measures against the cultivation and trafficking of cannabis within the Union and to consider taking measures against internet sites providing information on cultivation.
